pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.4: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see [Kd 8:3.1.6](pli-tv-kd8:3.1.6).
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.10: According to Vin-vn-ṭ.1626 (presumably commenting on _kaddamena_ in the Kaṅkhāvitaraṇī commentary): _Kaddamenāti udakānukaddamasukkhakaddamādiṁ saṅgaṇhāti_, “With mud means: water with mud, dry mud, etc., is included.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.7: I understand _anuvāta_ and _paribhaṇḍa_ to refer to long borders and short borders respectively.
